p: A linseed-oil-based polyol was employed for PU synthesis, and nanocomposite films with 0.5–10 wt% of Biocera A ® commercial particles (composed of silver, zinc, magnesium, calcium phosphate, alumina, and silica, with a particle size of 3–4 µm) were obtained by the casting-evaporation technique. Interestingly, systems with and without commercial particles showed antibacterial performance against E. coli, P. aeruginosa, S. aureus, and B. subtilis and were not cytotoxic against the Murine fibroblast NIH 3T3 cell line. They suggested that these systems would be useful for wound dressing applications [ 329].
